metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6213 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
fs/namespace.c in the Linux kernel before 4.9 does not restrict how manymounts may exist in a mount namespace, which allows local users to cause adenial of service (memory consumption and deadlock) via MS_BIND mountsystem calls, as demonstrated by a loop that triggers exponential growth inthe number of mounts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-57.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1038-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1038.45
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1042.46
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required
